ygData.subject: Re: Back to the Ark
ygData.msgSnippet: ... She watched Striker s motions.  She noticed that he frowned at her . She heard his words come out of his mouth, but his voice told her something different.

::Spears::

She watched Striker's motions.  She noticed that he frowned at her .  
She heard his words come out of his mouth, but his voice told her 
something different.  She saw that now, things between them would be 
different.  He would no longer see her as a friend, more like a 
possable threat.  He would no longer trust her with anything.  She 
wanted to be friends and friends must be honest with each other. She 
was now regretting her dicision. Maybe honesty wasn't the best polocy.
She walked along side him in silence.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Striker::
> 
> Striker stops as he hears Spears' story, his wolf face frowning. 
Could he 
> accept Spears, if she'd been a Predacon in the pase? Maximals who 
betrayed 
> seemed to have no trouble following the principles of their new 
factions, as 
> in the case of Perndabot, or Armdabot and Perhanabot before the two 
bots were 
> fuzed into the Alliance warrior, so why wouldn't Predacons? He nods.
> 
> "I will try to," he says, "Let's get going. Something might be up 
at the Ark."
> 
> Striker starts walking again, heading toward the Ark.
